docs.title: Welcome to BDXPy Documentation
docs.text: BDXPy is a Python library for managing and analyzing building data.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Easy-to-use APIs
  • Powerful data analysis tools
  • Modular design for scalability

Get started with installation instructions.

docs.title: Contributing to BDXPy
docs.text: We welcome contributions to BDXPy! Here’s how you can get started:

docs.title: Issues
docs.text: • Check open issues or create a new one if you find a bug.

docs.title: Pull Requests
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository.
  2. Create a feature branch.
  3. Submit a pull request with a description.

Thank you for your support!

docs.title: Who can I contact for support?
Installation
docs.text: To install BDXPy, use pip: ```bash pip install bdxpy

docs.title: bdxpy.DataLoader
docs.text: • load(file_path: str) -> DataFrame Load building data from a file.

docs.title: bdxpy.Analyzer
docs.text:
• run() Perform data analysis.

For a full list of classes and methods, visit the official API docs.

docs.title: Example 1: Basic Usage
docs.text: This example demonstrates how to use BDXPy to analyze building data.

docs.title: Code
docs.text:
```python from bdxpy import DataLoader

data = DataLoader.load("building_data.csv") print(data.summary())

docs.title: Example 2: Advanced Analysis
docs.text:
Perform advanced analysis with weather-adjusted modeling. ```python from bdxpy import WeatherModel

model = WeatherModel() model.fit(data) print(model.results())
